chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
S: (nat -> nat) -> Prop
R: (nat -> nat) -> Prop

Goal:
𝔻R R -> 𝔻R S -> 𝔻R (fun ν : nat -> nat => R ν \/ S ν)

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
dio_rel_conj : forall R S, 𝔻R R -> 𝔻R S -> 𝔻R (fun ν : nat -> nat => R ν /\ S ν)
dio_rel_eq : forall x y : nat, 𝔻R (fun ν : nat -> nat => ν x = ν y)
dio_rel_cst : forall x n : nat, 𝔻R (fun ν : nat -> nat => ν x = n)
dio_rel_mul : forall x y z : nat, 𝔻R (fun ν : nat -> nat => ν x = ν y * ν z)
dio_rel_add : forall x y z : nat, 𝔻R (fun ν : nat -> nat => ν x = ν y + ν z)
dio_rel = fun R => {f : dio_formula | forall ν : nat -> nat, ⟦f⟧ ν < -> R ν} : ((nat -> nat) -> Prop) -> Set Arguments dio_rel _%function_scope
Fin.cast : Fin.t ?m -> forall n : nat, ?m = n -> Fin.t n where ?m : [R : (nat -> nat) -> Prop S : (nat -> nat) -> Prop |- nat]
Nat.double_induction : forall R : nat -> nat -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq (Morphisms.respectful eq iff)) R -> (forall m : nat, R 0 m) -> (forall n : nat, R (Datatypes.S n) 0) -> (forall n m : nat, R n m -> R (Datatypes.S n) (Datatypes.S m)) -> forall n m : nat, R n m
de_bruijn_ext = fun (X : Type) (ν : nat -> X) (x : X) => fix dbe (n : nat) : X := match n with | 0 => x | S n0 => ν n0 end : forall X : Type, (nat -> X) -> X -> nat -> X Arguments de_bruijn_ext {X}%type_scope _%function_scope _ _%nat_scope
Fin.caseS' : forall (p : Fin.t (Datatypes.S ?n)) (P : Fin.t (Datatypes.S ?n) -> Type), P Fin.F1 -> (forall p0 : Fin.t ?n, P (Fin.FS p0)) -> P p where ?n : [R : (nat -> nat) -> Prop S : (nat -> nat) -> Prop |- nat]
df_pred = fix df_pred (f : dio_formula) (ν : nat -> nat) {struct f} : Prop := match f with | x≐⌞n⌟ => ν x = n | x≐y => ν x = ν y | df_op o x y z => ν x = de_op_sem o (ν y) (ν z) | df_bin o f0 g => df_op_sem o (df_pred f0 ν) (df_pred g ν) | ∃ f0 => exists n : nat, df_pred f0 n·ν end : dio_formula -> (nat -> nat) -> Prop Arguments df_pred _ _%function_scope
ZifyClasses.mkrel : forall (S T : Type) (R : S -> S -> Prop) (I : S -> T) (TR : T -> T -> Prop), (forall n m : S, R n m <-> TR (I n) (I m)) -> forall (s1 : S) (t1 : T), I s1 = t1 -> forall (s2 : S) (t2 : T), I s2 = t2 -> R s1 s2 < -> TR t1 t2
Acc_ind : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (P : A -> Prop), (forall x : A, (forall y : A, R y x -> Acc R y) -> (forall y : A, R y x -> P y) -> P x) -> forall x : A, Acc R x -> P x
Inductive Acc (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (x : A) : Prop := Acc_intro : (forall y : A, R y x -> Acc R y) -> Acc R x Arguments Acc [A]%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments Acc_intro [A]%type_scope [R]%function_scope _ _%function_scope
Nat.eqf = fun f g : nat -> bool => forall n : nat, f n = g n : (nat -> bool) -> (nat -> bool) -> Prop Arguments Nat.eqf (_ _)%function_scope
lt = fun n m : nat => S n <= m : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments lt (_ _)%nat_scope
df_pred_conj : forall (f g : dio_formula) (ν : nat -> nat), ⟦f∧g⟧ ν = (⟦f⟧ ν /\ ⟦g⟧ ν)
add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments add (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.gcd = fix gcd (a b : nat) {struct a} : nat := match a with | 0 => b | S a' => gcd (b mod S a') (S a') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.gcd (_ _)%nat_scope
max = fix max (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S n' => match m with | 0 => n | S m' => S (max n' m') end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments max (_ _)%nat_scope
min = fix min (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S n' => match m with | 0 => 0 | S m' => S (min n' m') end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments min (_ _)%nat_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
gtof : forall A : Type, (A -> nat) -> A -> A -> Prop
sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => n | S k => match m with | 0 => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments sub (_ _)%nat_scope
mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments mul (_ _)%nat_scope
pow = fix pow (n m : nat) {struct m} : nat := match m with | 0 => 1 | S m0 => n * pow n m0 end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments pow (_ _)%nat_scope
shiftl = fun a : (fun _ : nat => nat) 0 => nat_rect (fun _ : nat => nat) a (fun _ : nat => double) : (fun _ : nat => nat) 0 -> forall n : nat, (fun _ : nat => nat) n Arguments shiftl (_ _)%nat_scope
Inductive le (n : nat) : nat -> Prop := le_n : n <= n | le_S : forall m : nat, n <= m -> n <= S m Arguments le (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments le_n _%nat_scope Arguments le_S (_ _)%nat_scope
ge = fun n m : nat => m <= n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments ge (_ _)%nat_scope
gt = fun n m : nat => m < n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gt (_ _)%nat_scope
